thread.title: Golf Star Targeted On Twitter For Playing Golf With The President
thread.title_full: Golf Star Targeted On Twitter For Playing Golf With The President

author: Fred Maxwell
title: Golf Star Targeted On Twitter For Playing Golf With The President
text:
Golf Star Targeted On Twitter For Playing Golf With The President "... shame and anger ..." Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Professional golfer Rory McIlroy received a lot of heat after a Twitter post showed him playing golf with President Donald Trump at Trump International Golf Club in Florida. 
The photo showing the PGA star and the president, joined by former New York Yankees outfielder Paul O’Neill and ClearSports CEO Garry Singer, was posted by ClearSports on Sunday. Big battle today at Trump International with Clear CEO Garry Singer @McIlroyRory @PaulONeillYES @realDonaldTrump Drain the putt… pic.twitter.com/AZJqEVtlBT 
After the photo was posted, McIlroy — the third-ranked player in the world — received scathing criticism for his choice in golf partners. 
Many on Twitter expressed anger at the four-time champion. @BePeeArr one of my childhood heroes has unfettered access to the president and the only thing I feel is shame and anger.Nothing makes sense Why in heaven's name would Rory McIlroy play golf with Trump?I hope he never wins another tournament. 
While many of the tweets were critical of McIlroy, there were also tweets of support. Advertisement - story continues below 
— Buck m louis (@BuckingmBuck) February 21, 2017 @ClearSportsLLC @McIlroyRory @PaulONeillYES @realDonaldTrump congrats Rory,thanks for your support, ignore all the losers,good luck this yr. 
— Walt Harris (@kc10gineer) February 21, 2017 
Also critical of McIlroy was Lawrence Donegan, former Guardian golf correspondent, who said, “I literally can’t believe that McIlroy has done this.” 
Another U.K. sports journalist, Ewan MacKenna, agreed, saying, “You don’t turn down a round of golf with the American president but you do turn down a round of golf with this American president.” 
McIlroy told No Laying Up he had not planned to play golf over the weekend due to a stress fracture to his ribs, but after being contacted Saturday night and asked if he would join Trump on Sunday morning, he “had to make an exception for the president.” 
Describing the president’s golf skills, McIlroy said, “He probably shot around 80. He’s a decent player for a guy in his 70s!” 
McIlroy is not the only golf pro who has been invited to join Trump on the course. 
The president has also played with Tiger Woods and Ernie Els since he took office. What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
